alert.note: Alert for Clay (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 8:36PM EDT until August 07 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL CLAY COUNTY... At 836 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms had weakened; however, excessive runoff from previous heavy rainfall will continue to produce localized flash flooding across the warned area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Urban, Byron, Portersburg and Deer Lick. This includes the following streams and drainages... Ephram Branch, Horse Creek, Little Goose Creek, Goose Creek, Grays Fork, Martin Creek, South Fork Rockcastle River, Hooppole Creek, Urban Fork, West Fork Pigeon Roost Branch and Laurel River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
